intro: Galium sellowianum, commonly known as Brazilian bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers during the summer months. Its flowers are typically surrounded by two bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Galium sellowianum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
